**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-22T07:13:30Z" title="04/22/2015 07:13  AM" data-short="9 yr">April 22, 2015</time> by ShadowZone**

A big wholeheartedly meant THANK YOU to Squad and the modders. Cheers for some great final devnotes before the big release day.

I can't await it. Next weeks are going to be filled with awesomeness, xplosions and SCIENCE!
A new easter egg? It could be The Magic Boulder, a rouge planet which you have to discover or maybe something to do with all the monoliths in the system.

Before 1.0 hits, I too, want to say a big thank you to Squad for producing this great game, to the YouTubers who helped me learn how to orbit, go to worlds a far, and bring my imagination to reality, and finally to the forum at large for inspiration, hilarious postings, and developer quality mods. 

I bought KSP after 0.18 and also just after falling in love with my first course in orbital mechanics and rocket science as a sophomore in Aerospace Engineering. The build-fly-dream playstyle of KSP kept my aerospace dreams alive through the tough courses and late nights in the computer lab with gravity turn rockets, orbital rendezvous, and 3 body programs until now, where I started working with trajectories at a company who names their rockets and spacecraft after birds of prey and mythical flying creatures ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif).

Following the hype for every release and looking back at how far this game has come, brings a strong sense of both nostalgia and excitement for 1.0! To the best $23 I have ever spent and only joyful tears!!

You'll need it ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif)

I think this is the third time I ever wrote in the forum (at least one post was lost in the datapocalypse some time ago). 

I've been playing KSP since v0.7.3. 

I remember quite well when I started it up the first time, it was late at night, but even with an hard day at work looming on me the day after, I spent a sizeable chunk of the night just throwing rockets at the sky.

I've seen all of the Scott Manley almost from the beginning, and reading the forum and checking the mods have been part of my daily routine for the last few years. 

I've understood more about orbital mechanics from KSP than all the science studies I did in my life, and it revamped my interests in astronomy.

I've bought multiple copies of KSP to gift friends with. 

Well, i guess that what I wanted to say was just : 

Thank you Squad, for Kerbal Space Program, Jeb and all the fish.

Thanks you guys! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) I can easily say that KSP has been the most interesting game I've ever played and after 3 years I'm still not burned out on it!
Y'all had me at the science lab changes... will science gain overall be tuned to a more sensible level to account for this? (It's currently very high and easy to max the tree...)

Thank you! I think I haven't said that enough in the last four years.

Thank you Felipe, for envisioning this great game, and for doing it despite all odds.

Thank you SQUAD, not only for a great game, but for the deep insight into your project work. 

Thank you for the great community management, and demonstrating that agile development can actually work for games as well.

The game is great, but what amazed me the most was how you went from amateurs to a well-organized and agile development company. I can't remember a single commercial studio that is so transparent and has such healthy relations to its customers. I have probably read every single devnote (and the stuff that was published earlier). I have quoted multiple passages from them to my team mates and my own project leader. I hope this is just the beginning of SQUAD, and that you are able to create many more exciting projects - be it something in addition to KSP or otherwise.

Now, after 4 years of this experience it feels like I mugged you by just investing about 10 dollars into this game. I will find new ways to spend money on you.
Thanks for making my favorite game of all time!
Thank you SQUAD for all your hard work, your wonderful game and the amazing community you've created!

Yes, thank you so much SQUAD! I have been waiting for a game like this all my life. Lego in space! I have lost countless hours of sleep, my performance has dropped at work due to fatigue, I've abandoned ALL other games and had tellings-off from the wife all for KSP. I'm even spending money to stream this great game on Twitch! I don't regret a single second ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif) You've also gathered together the best on-line community I've come across so far.
